conversation.speech: Let's modify the format slightly to make it unambiguous how to handle line wrapping. Some of the speeches should be several lines. You can generate the traditional pseudo-latin nonsense that printers use for this purpose to provide the bulk you need.

conversation.speaker: AI
conversation.speech: To incorporate unambiguous line wrapping into the screenplay format, we can adopt the convention of indenting subsequent lines of any speech. This ensures that multi-line speeches are clearly delineated while preserving readability.

specification.description: Speaker Identification: Each speech begins with the speaker's name in uppercase letters, followed by a colon.
Dialogue Presentation: The first line of dialogue begins immediately after the colon. If the dialogue extends to additional lines, each subsequent line is indented by two spaces.
example: USER: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Quisque ac lorem sed arcu hendrerit varius.

specification.description: Sequential Structure: Each exchange starts on a new line, maintaining clear speaker transitions.
Consistent Line Wrapping: Wrapping occurs at word boundaries, not mid-word. Ensure no ambiguity between new speeches and wrapped lines.
